pullRequest.body:
This is completely import-directed.


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
The `no_lost_declarations` script reports:


* `--++` `theorem map_dfinsupp_sumAddHom [AddCommMonoid R] [AddCommMonoid S] [∀ i, AddZeroClass (β i)]`

---
* 0  added declarations
* 1  removed declarations
* 69  paired declarations

---

So, it seems that the script should handle repetitions better!  The balancing of `+` and `-` means that it found that line as many times as it was removed: all is good!
What's the motivation for this specific cut-off?
Initially getting rid of linear algebra, but in the end whatever needed more than `import Mathlib.Data.Finset.Preimage`

The fact that you are removing the `IsCentralScalar` instance but not the `IsScalarTower` one makes me think you're doing something wrong. Reading through, I am not getting a feeling I understand what should be in this file vs `Data.DFinsupp.Lemmas`.

Here is a suggestion: People (eg @zeramorphic) have wanted finitely supported functions where the support is not the set of elements not sent to `0`, but instead the set of elements not sent to a specific fixed element `a`. Tentatively, this means that `Finsupp`/`DFinsupp` have an interpretation as non-algebraic objects and that we should:
* Have a file/folder under `Data` for everything that can be said about `Finsupp`/`DFinsupp` without algebra (past the use of `0`, for now)
* Have a file/folder under `Algebra` for algebraic uses (most of the material we currently have, I think)
* Have a file/folder under `Order` for purely order theoretic uses (there is currently very little of that)
* Have a file/folder under `Algebra.Order` for the algebraic order theoretic uses (that we have a bit)

Also note that when thou change `DFinsupp`, thou shalt change `Finsupp` too. I'm happy for it to be in a separate PR to avoid having to shuffle everything twice until I give you the green light, though.

The fact that you are removing the `IsCentralScalar` instance but not the `IsScalarTower` one makes me think you're doing something wrong. Reading through, I am not getting a feeling I understand what should be in this file vs `Data.DFinsupp.Lemmas`.

Here is a suggestion: People (eg @zeramorphic) have wanted finitely supported functions where the support is not the set of elements not sent to `0`, but instead the set of elements not sent to a specific fixed element `a`. Tentatively, this means that `Finsupp`/`DFinsupp` have an interpretation as non-algebraic objects and that we should:
* Have a file/folder under `Data` for everything that can be said about `Finsupp`/`DFinsupp` without algebra (past the use of `0`, for now)
* Have a file/folder under `Algebra` for algebraic uses (most of the material we currently have, I think)
* Have a file/folder under `Order` for purely order theoretic uses (there is currently very little of that)
* Have a file/folder under `Algebra.Order` for the algebraic order theoretic uses (that we have a bit)

Also note that when thou change `DFinsupp`, thou shalt change `Finsupp` too. I'm happy for it to be in a separate PR to avoid having to shuffle everything twice until I give you the green light, though.

pullRequest.title: chore: split Data.DFinsupp.Basic

nodes.body:
The `no_lost_declarations` script reports:


* `--++` `theorem map_dfinsupp_sumAddHom [AddCommMonoid R] [AddCommMonoid S] [∀ i, AddZeroClass (β i)]`

---

* 1  removed declarations

So, it seems that the script should handle repetitions better!  The balancing of `+` and `-` means that it found that line as many times as it was removed: all is good!
What's the motivation for this specific cut-off?
Initially getting rid of linear algebra, but in the end whatever needed more than `import Mathlib.Data.Finset.Preimage`

The fact that you are removing the `IsCentralScalar` instance but not the `IsScalarTower` one makes me think you're doing something wrong. Reading through, I am not getting a feeling I understand what should be in this file vs `Data.DFinsupp.Lemmas`.

Here is a suggestion: People (eg @zeramorphic) have wanted finitely supported functions where the support is not the set of elements not sent to `0`, but instead the set of elements not sent to a specific fixed element `a`. * Have a file/folder under `Algebra.Order` for the algebraic order theoretic uses (that we have a bit)

Also note that when thou change `DFinsupp`, thou shalt change `Finsupp` too. I'm happy for it to be in a separate PR to avoid having to shuffle everything twice until I give you the green light, though.
